channel.title: Twitter on Kevin Cui
channel.description: Recent content in Twitter on Kevin Cui

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: January 2018 - April 2018
item.description: "When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure"https://t.co/AOKfuZwpSp — Jonathan Korman 🔥🗽 (@miniver) January 11, 2018 Three junior developers are performing higher than a pair of senior developers, which are all performing higher than one expert. That's how you play development poker? Let me show you my poker face. — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 30, 2018 Terrible day. Parked my red Tesla convertible outside Cape Canaveral Space Center and I’m pretty sure it’s been towed.

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: October 2017 - December 2017
item.description: I feel so good that our scrum board doesn't have a column called "to test". The beauty is that testing can happen anytime. #30daysoftesting — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 30, 2017 4 levels of Testing Inception: Real World Cloned Replicated World Simulated Parallel World Mocked Fantasy World Go deeper, don't be stuck. — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 2, 2017 My 1st #testbash experience was really amazing! Great talks, awesome testers, nice location, decent food.

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: May 2017 - September 2017
item.description: "USB sounds like a backup​ in case the USA fails" 😂https://t.co/Wma4Buitof — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 1, 2017 Sometimes an expected bad practice could bring an unexpected good result. — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 2, 2017 Don't judge a (face)book (user) by its cover (image). — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 5, 2017 Saw a meme: Locks car keys in house, house keys locked in car... 🤦‍♂️ — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 .

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: January 2017 - April 2017
item.description: Bug <-> Debug Test <-> Detest Is that a kind of coincidence? — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) December 30, 2016 1. 🎥: 👯🐇💨🚶㊙🚪🐈🐛👒🍵👸👰👑♠♥♣♦😴 2. 📺: 🐺🐯🐲💮🐙🐟... 👑❤💔🔞🔥💥🔪... 💀😱💀💀😱😱💀💀💀😶💀💀💀💀💀... — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 4, 2017 Declare variables not war, Get bugs fixed not mindset. — 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 14, 2017 A tool for work: 20 years ago, a tool is a tool. 10 years ago, a tool is a software.

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: June 2016 - December 2016
item.description: 1/4 How does #QA prevent defects? My opinion is "Not really". Similar to how to prevent sickness? — @KevCui June 8, 2016 2/4 Right release & #QA processes, like good habits, are necessary but not sufficient. Some unexpected virus can still break immune system. — @KevCui June 8, 2016 3/4 Instead of preventing deflects, #QA should be able to point out issues as early as possible and figure out the risks as well.
